citation.article-title: Pseudomonas pseudoalcaligenes subsp. konjaci subsp. nov., the causal agent of bacterial leaf blight of konjac, (Amorphophalus konjac Koch.).

p.s: Description of Pseudomonas pseudoalcaligenes subsp. konjaci subsp. nov.
Pseudomonas pseudoalcaligenes subsp. konjaci (konja'ci. konjac name of host species; L. n. konjaci of konjac)
Cells are gram-negative rods 0.5 μm wide by 1.8 to 2.3 μm long, are motile by means of a single polar flagellum, and accumulate poly-β-hydroxybutyrate.
Colonies on YP agar are white, round, transparent, smooth, slightly convex, and 2 to 3 mm in diameter after incubation for 5 days at 28°C.
A water-soluble brown pigment is produced on King medium B.
Positive for nitrate reduction but negative for denitrification.
Growth occurs at 41°C but not at 4°C.
Utilizes D-fructose, D-ribose, D-mannitol, glycerol, ethanol, several amino acids, and organic acids as sole carbon sources.
No growth occurs with the other sugars and polysaccharides tested (Table 3).
The guanine-plus-cytosine content of the deoxyribonucleic acid is 66 to 68 mol%.
Additional characteristics are listed in Table 2.
Strain K2 is the type strain and has been deposited with the American Type Culture Collection as ATCC 33996 and with the Plant Diseases Division Culture Collection as PDDCC 7733.
